subject: Home & DIY
title: Circadian Lighting and Sleep Science
description: One-minute skill: Circadian Lighting and Sleep Science.

hook.text: Blue-white light at night suppresses melatonin and ruins sleep. Smart lighting can shift color to protect your cycle.

buildup.text: Sunlight runs blue (5500K+) by day and warm (2700K) at sunset. Our brains use this shift as a sleep signal.

discovery.text: Tunable bulbs auto-shift from cool blue-white mornings to warm amber evenings, mimicking the sun's natural arc.

twist.text: Workers in offices with circadian lighting report 18% better sleep and 12% higher productivity.

climax.text: Apple, Google, and Hue now offer circadian schedules. Your lights follow the sun without you touching a button.

punchline.text: The right color light at the right time fixes sleep.

quiz.question: How does blue-white light at night affect the body?
options: It suppresses melatonin production and disrupts sleep
It increases body temperature and heart rate
It causes eye strain and headaches only
